item.title: Schedule and Lectorials
item.description:
Here is your road map for the course!

Week 1-4: lectures (online)

Week 1

  • Introduction to regression analysis

  • Simple Linear Regression

    • Least-squares estimation of the parameters

  • Basics of Rprogramming

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 2

  • Simple Linear Regression

    • Model adequacy checking

    • Hypothesis testing on the Slope and Intercept

    • Interval estimation in simple linear regression

    • Prediction of new observations

    • Coefficient of determination

    • Regression through the origin

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 3

  • Multiple linear regression

    • Introduction

    • Estimation of the model parameters

    • Model Adequacy checking

    • Hypothesis testing multiple linear regression

    • Confidence intervals in multiple regression

    • Prediction of new observations

    • Standardized regression coefficients

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 4

  • Model adequacy checking

    • Introduction

    • Residual Analysis

    • Detection and Treatment of Outliers

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 5-6: Discussion/practical (in class)

Week 5

  • Lack of Fit of Regression Model

  • Brief introduction to tidyverse

  • Problem discussion and Regression Analysis with R

  • Other open-source softwares for regression analysis

  • Other commercial softwares for regression analysis

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 6

  • Transformations and Weighting to Treat Model Inadequacies

    • Variance-stabilization transformations

    • Transformations to linearize the model

    • Analytical methods for selecting a transformation

  • Problem discussion and Regression Analysis with R

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 7: mid exam (in class)

  • Generalized and weighted least squares

    • Generalized least squares

    • Weighted least squares

Week 7: Mid-semester Examination

Week 8-12: lectures (online)

Week 8

  • Diagnostics for leverage and influence

    • Importance of detecting influential observations

    • Leverage

    • Measures of influence

    • Treatment of influential observations

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 9

  • Regression with qualitative regressors

    • Indicator variables

    • Indicator variable with more than two levels

    • More than one indicator variable

    • Interpretation of results

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 10

  • Variable Selection Procedures

    • Introduction

    • All possible regressions

    • Forward selection procedure

    • Backward elimination procedure

    • Stepwise method

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 11

  • Multicollinearity

    • Introduction

    • Multocollinearity diagnostics

    • Treatments for dealing with multicollinearity

ğŸ“šSlides ğŸ“’ Reading ğŸ“Š Data Sets ğŸ“ Problems ğŸ”–Answers

Week 12

  • Bootstapping in Regression

    • Introduction to bootstrap sampling

    • Bootstrap sampling in regression

    • Bootsrap confidence intervals

Week 13-14: Discussion/practical (in class)

Week 13

  • Problem discussion and regression modelling with R

  • Problem discussion and regression modelling with R

Week 15: Revision (in class)

Week 15: Revision

  • Current state-of-art techniques in regression analysis and statistical modelling
